title: Comparative Experiment on Learner Control Levels for Optimizing Online Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A social sector job training program for working professionals to enhance work efficiency, conducted in a BYOD environment with project-based assessments to measure learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners can compare online learning efficiency under varying control levels (low/high)
Learners can select optimal learning pathways based on time-to-performance ratios
Learners can propose instructional designs that balance cognitive load and learning time
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
